H0.text: Biologically-speaking, what name is given to an organ that serves no evident purpose. Rudiment

H1.text: Biologically-speaking, what name is given to an organ that serves no evident purpose. Atavism

H2.text: Biologically-speaking, what name is given to an organ that serves no evident purpose. Anachronism

H3.text: Biologically-speaking, what name is given to an organ that serves no evident purpose. Vestige

A4.text: the human vermiform appendix, vestigial in the sense of retaining no significant digestive function

A5.text: Vestigiality is the retention, during the process of evolution, of genetically determined structures or attributes that have lost some or all of the ancestral function in a given species
